label.value: transcription factor binding site identification by ChIP-Seq assay

definition.value: A transcription factor binding site assay that utilizes ChIP-seq technology.

label.value: epigenetic modification assay

definition.value: An assay that identifies epigenetic modifications including histone modifications, open chromatin, and DNA methylation.

label.value: NextSeq 500

definition.value: A DNA sequencer which is a desktop sequencer ideal for smaller-scale studies manufactured by the Illumina corporation. It supports sequencing of single, long or short insert paired end clone libraries relying on sequencing by synthesis technology.

label.value: Illumina HiSeq 1000

definition.value: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation, with a single flow cell and a throughput of up to 35 Gb per day. It supports sequencing of single, long or short insert paired end clone libraries relying on sequencing by synthesis technology.

label.value: Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 tiling array

definition.value: A tiling array which is  a comprehensive whole human genome expression array manufactured by the Affymetrix corporation. Built to analyze DNA sequence copy number by comparative genomic hybridization for human DNA against 47,000 transcripts and variants.

label.value: SOLiD 4 System

definition.value: An AB SOLid System which is manufacted by the Applied Biosystems corporation. Built upon SOLiD sequencing technology, the machine generates greater than 1 billion mappable reads per run.

label.value: Human Exon 1.0 ST tilling array

definition.value: A tiling microarray which is manufactured by the Affymetrix corporation. Built to analyze 3' DNA sequence copy number by comparative genomic hybridization for human DNA against 28,000 genes. It  can be used for gene expression and alternative splicing assay

label.value: Human Genome U133 tiling array

definition.value: A tiling array which is manufactured by the Affymetrix corporation. Built to analyze DNA sequence copy number by comparative genomic hybridization for human DNA against 39,000 transcripts and variants.

label.value: Genome Analyzer IIe

definition.value: An Illumina Genome Analyzer II which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation. It supports sequencing of single, long or short insert paired end clone libraries relying on sequencing by synthesis technology. The Genome Analyzer IIe makes industry-leading next-generation sequencing technology accessible to more laboratories.

label.value: SAGE ditag library preparation

definition.value: A library preparation in which tags identifiying transcripts are created, ligated to form ditags, amplified, concatemerized and ligated into a vector to create a library.

label.value: serial analysis of gene expression assay

definition.value: A transcription profiling assay that quantifies RNA through creating short signature tags of the messages and ligating them into a larger molecule than was sequenced.

label.value: genotyping by tiling array assay

definition.value: A genotyping by array assay that uses tiling array technology.

label.value: genotyping by SNP array assay

definition.value: A genotyping by array assay that uses SNP array technology.

label.value: parallel analysis of RNA structure assay

definition.value: A single-nucleotide-resolution nucleic acid structure mapping assay that performs simultaneous in vitro profiling of the secondary structure of thousands of RNA species at single nucleotide resolution using enzymatic probing based on deep sequencing fragments of RNAs that were treated with structure-specific enzymes

label.value: translation-associated transcript leader sequencing assay

definition.value: An RNA-seq assay that combines TL-seq with polysome fractionation

label.value: transcript leader sequencing assay

definition.value: An RNA-seq assay that combines enzymatic capture of m(7)G-capped mRNA 5' ends with high-throughput sequencing.

label.value: peptide mass fingerprinting assay

definition.value: A mass spectrometry assay that measures the absolute mass of the cleaved peptides derived from an unknown protein of interest. These masses are then compared to values for known protein sequences to identify the unknown protein.

label.value: array based nucleic acid structure mapping assay

definition.value: An assay which aims to provide information about the in vivo organization/structure of nucleic acids using chemical or enzymatic probes using a microarray.

label.value: micrococcal nuclease digestion followed by tiling array assay

definition.value: An array based nucleic acid structure mapping assay that identifies nucleosome positions genome wide, by detection of regions protected by nucleosomes from digestion by micrococal nuclease using tiling array assays

label.value: ribosomal profiling by sequencing assay

definition.value: A RNA-seq assay that sequences only mRNA protected by the ribosome during translation.

label.value: assay for transposase-accessible chromatin using sequencing

definition.value: An assay to capture the location of open chromatin, DNA-binding proteins, individual nucleosomes and chromatin compaction at nucleotide resolution by Tn5 transposase insertion.

label.value: chromatin isolation by RNA purification sequencing assay

definition.value: A detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay that measures regions of the genome which are bound by a specific RNA (or a by a ribonucleoprotein containing the RNA of interest) using high-throughput sequencing.

label.value: self-transcribing active regulatory region sequencing assay

definition.value: An RNA-seq assay that identifies the sequences that act as transcriptional enhancers in a direct, quantitative, and genome-wide manner from sheared genomic DNA.

label.value: carbon-copy chromosome conformation capture assay followed by sequencing assay

definition.value: A carbon-copy chromosome conformation capture assay to analyze the organization of chromosomes in an unbiased, genome-wide manner using high throughput sequening following carbon-copy chromosome conformation capture.

label.value: individual-nucleotide resolution cross-linking and immunoprecipitation sequencing assay

definition.value: A cross-linking immunoprecipitation high-throughput sequencing assay that identifies protein-RNA interactions using UV light to covalently bind proteins and RNA molecules, allowing for a very stringent purification of the linked protein-RNA complexes.

label.value: RNA Bind-n-Seq assay

definition.value: An RNA-seq assay that comprehensively characterizes sequence and structural specificity of RNA binding proteins (RBPs).

label.value: polyA-site sequencing assay

definition.value: A RNA-seq assay that quantitatively profiles RNA polyadenylation at the transcriptome level.

label.value: surface plasmon resonance sensor chip

definition.value: A device that is used as a binding surface for ligand during a surface plasmon resonance assay, consisting of a glass plate to which a metal film is attached

label.value: enzyme-linked antibody

definition.value: A processed material that is comprised of an antibody that is covalently linked to an enzyme through bioconjugation. The enzyme can be used as a detection method when the enzyme's reaction produces a detectable signal, for example a color change when the substrate is added.

label.value: Illumina HiSeq 3000

definition.value: A DNA sequencer manufactured by Illumina corporation, with a single flow cell and a throughput of more than 200 Gb per day.

label.value: Illumina HiSeq 4000

definition.value: A DNA sequencer manufactured by Illumina corporation, with two flow cell and a throughput of more than 400 Gb per day.

label.value: 3D structure determining assay of a MHC:ligand complex

definition.value: A MHC:ligand binding assay that uses a 3D structure determination of bound complex assay.

label.value: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific protection from infectious challenge based on pathogen burden

definition.value: A B cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a epitope protection experiment based on pathogen burden.

label.value: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific protection from tumor challenge

definition.value: A B cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a epitope protection experiment based on tumor burden.

label.value: microarray assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that uses a microarray.

label.value: NMR assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: A B cell epitope equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses a nuclear magnetic resonance assay.

label.value: assay measuring T cell epitope specific biological activity

definition.value: A T cell epitope recognition assay that detects biological activity.

label.value: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells

definition.value: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects production of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells.

label.value: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells

definition.value: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells.

label.value: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific oncostatin M production by T cells

definition.value: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects oncostatin M production by T cells.

label.value: assay measuring a binding constant of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex

definition.value: A T cell epitope recognition assay that quantitavely characterizes the binding of a TCR with a ligand by determining a binding constant.

label.value: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells

definition.value: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.

label.value: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells

definition.value: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.

label.value: in vitro assay measuring epitope specific T cell killing

definition.value: A T cell epitope specific killing assay that uses an in vitro cell killing assay.

label.value: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific granzyme A release by T cells

definition.value: A T cell epitope specific granzyme A release assay that uses a cytometric bead array assay.

label.value: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific granzyme A release by T cells

definition.value: A T cell epitope specific granzyme A release assay that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.

label.value: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific granzyme B release by T cells

definition.value: A T cell epitope specific granzyme B release assay that uses a cytometric bead array assay.

label.value: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific granzyme B release by T cells

definition.value: A T cell epitope specific granzyme B release assay that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.

label.value: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells

definition.value: An assay of epitope specific macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.

label.value: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific oncostatin M production by T cells

definition.value: An assay of epitope specific oncostatin M production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
